member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IVariableBitrateMediaPlugin
member.summary: Represents a media plug-in that supports variable bitrates.
member.remarks: Implement IAdaptiveMediaPlugin instead for adaptive media plugins. However, this subset interface can be used for plug-ins that supports variable bitrates without track or stream info.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IMediaPlugin
member.summary: Represents the base interface for any media plug-in.
member.remarks: This interface contains members common to all media plug-ins. Implementing this interface by itself does not define any specific playback capabilities.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IPlugin
member.summary: Defines the minimum that a plug-in must implement to be loaded by the SMF plug-in architecture.
member.remarks: The SMF plug-in architecture is based on the Managed Extensibility Framework (MEF).

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IPlugin.Load
member.summary: Loads the plug-in.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IPlugin.Unload
member.summary: Unloads the plug-in.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IPlugin.IsLoaded
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a plug-in is currently loaded.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IPlugin.LogReady
member.summary: Occurs when the log is ready.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IPlugin.PluginLoaded
member.summary: Occurs when the plug-in is loaded.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IPlugin.PluginUnloaded
member.summary: Occurs when the plug-in is unloaded.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IPlugin.PluginLoadFailed
member.summary: Occurs when the plug-in fails to load.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IPlugin.PluginUnloadFailed
member.summary: Occurs when the plug-in fails to unload.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IMediaPlugin.Play
member.summary: Starts playing the current media file from its current position.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IMediaPlugin.Pause
member.summary: Pauses the currently playing media.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IMediaPlugin.Stop
member.summary: Stops playing the current media.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IMediaPlugin.RequestLog
member.summary: Requests that this plugin generate a LogEntry via the LogReady event
Schedules an ad to be played by this plugin.
member.param: The source of the ad content.
The delivery method of the ad content.
The duration of the ad content that should be played. If ommitted the plugin will play the full duration of the ad content.
The position within the media where this ad should be played. If ommited ad will begin playing immediately.
The position within the clip that the clip should start from. If ommited ad will begin playing from its beginning.
The URL where the user should be directed when they click the ad.
Indicates if the timeline of the currently playing media should be paused while the ad is playing.
Another scheduled ad that this ad should be appended to. If ommitted this ad will be scheduled independently.
User data.
Indicates that the clip should replace the main content for the cooresponding time slot.
member.returns: A reference to the IAdContext that contains information about the scheduled ad.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IMediaPlugin.AutoPlay
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the media plays immediately after the media file is opened.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IMediaPlugin.CacheMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the cache mode

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IMediaPlugin.Balance
member.summary: Gets or sets the ratio of the volume level across stereo speakers.
member.remarks: The value is in the range between -1 and 1. The default value of 0 signifies an equal volume between left and right stereo speakers. A value of -1 represents 100 percent volume in the speakers on the left, and a value of 1 represents 100 percent volume in the speakers on the right.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IMediaPlugin.BufferingProgress
member.summary: Gets the percentage of the current buffering that is completed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IMediaPlugin.BufferingTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time for the current buffering action.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IAdaptiveMediaPlugin
member.summary: Represents a media plug-in that can play adaptive media encoded with multiple bitrates (IIS Smooth Streaming).
member.remarks: You implement this interface for a plug-in that supports adaptive media streams.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IAdaptiveMediaPlugin.ClearBuffer(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Empties the contents of the buffer leaving only the specified amount of buffered time.
member.param: The amount of time to leave in the buffer.

member.summary: Downloads all of the available data from the specified track.
member.param: the track that contains the data to be downloaded.

member.summary: Cancels any queued downloads for the specified track.
member.param: the track that contains the data that should not be downloaded.

member.summary: Downloads the specified chunk from the specified track.
member.param: the track that contains the data to be downloaded.
the chunk to be downloaded.

member.summary: Specifies the range of video bitrates that can be downloaded.
member.param: the minimum bitrate that can be downloaded.
the maximum bitrate that can be downloaded.
flush the buffer

member.summary: Accepts the ad and plays it ASAP

member.summary: A generic plugin that will be loaded by the Player and given a reference to the Player so that it can perform the plugin specific functionality

member.summary: A plugin that implements heuristics for managing multiple IMediaPlugins running in the same application

member.summary: Determines if this plugin supports management of the specified media plugin.

member.returns: True if this media plugin is supported.

member.summary: Registers the specified media plugin so that it can be managed by this heuristics plugin.

The relative priority of this media plugin
Indicates if synchronization of this media plugin with others should be enabled.

member.summary: Unregisters the specified media plugin so that it is no longer managed by this heuristics plugin.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.ILiveDvrMediaPlugin
member.summary: Represents a media plug-in with live DVR capabilities.
member.remarks:
This interface keeps track of the current live position, which may be different than the current position if the user has scrubbed back to an earlier point in the video using the timeline.
You implement this interface for a plug-in that supports live media streams.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.ILiveDvrMediaPlugin.IsSourceLive
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current media is live.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.ILiveDvrMediaPlugin.IsLivePosition
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether playback is currently at the live position.
member.remarks: This property is only used on a live media stream with DVR capabilities, such as an adaptive stream (where the client can scrub to a point on the timeline previous to the live position).

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.ILiveDvrMediaPlugin.LivePosition
member.summary: Gets the live playback position.
member.remarks: This property is only used on a live media stream with DVR capabilities, such as an adaptive stream (where the client can scrub to a point on the timeline previous to the live position).

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.ILiveDvrMediaPlugin.LivePlaybackStartPosition
member.summary: Gets/Sets the position within a live media where playback should start.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.ILiveDvrMediaPlugin.LiveEventCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when a live event has completed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.ILogWriter
member.summary: Defines the members a class must implement to be a LogWriter plug-in.

remarks.para: This plugin is useful for the recording of logging information.

DebugLogWriter is the ILogWriter implementation that SMF provides. You can write logging plug-ins that write log entries to other locations, such as to an XML string that is sent by a Web service to a database.
In addition to implementing this interface, a class must have an ExportLogWriter attribute to be used as a Logging plug-in.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.ILogWriter.WriteLog(Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.LogEntry)
member.summary: Writes a specified LogEntry to the LogWriter.
member.param: The LogEntry to write.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.ILogWriter.LogWriteFailed
member.summary: Occurs when writing to this LogWriter fails.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.ILogWriter.LogWriteSuccessful
member.summary: Occurs after a successful write operation to this LogWriter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IMarkerProvider
member.summary: Represents an object that can get MediaMarkers from some source.

remarks.para: An IMarkerProvider object knows how to get MediaMarkers. The provided default implementation gets Markers using the W3C Timed Text Authoring Format (TTAF) 1.0 specification.

In general, an IMarkerProvider is an object that can return an IEnumerable collection of MediaMarker objects from somewhere. You can define an IMarkerProvider implementation that returns an IEnumerable collection of MediaMarker objects from any source you want an application to use (for example, from an XML file on the network or a Web service).

The PollingInterval is an optional property (nullable) that can be used to have the provider check for markers at a specific interval of time. This allows you to define a marker provider that can add or remove markers dynamically, such as during a live event.

An IMarkerProvider has a collection of new markers added and markers removed that are detected after the retrieval of markers. The Id property of a marker is used to determine if it is new or if an existing marker has been removed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IMarkerProvider.BeginRetrievingMarkers
member.summary: Begins retrieving markers from the Source location.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IMarkerProvider.StopRetrievingMarkers
member.summary: Stops retrieving markers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IMarkerProvider.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the location for getting markers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IMarkerProvider.PollingInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the timing interval for polling (optional).

member.name: E:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IMarkerProvider.NewMarkers
member.summary: Occurs when new markers are found.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IMarkerProvider.MarkersRemoved
member.summary: Occurs when markers have been removed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IMarkerProvider.RetrieveMarkersFailed
member.summary: Occurs when retrieving markers fails.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IAdHost
member.summary: An interface that provides everything needed to play ads in the player. Internally, this is used by VPAID advertising plugins.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IAdHost.Play
member.summary: Causes the player to play the video

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IAdHost.Pause
member.summary: Causes the player to pause the video

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IAdHost.AddPlayBlock(System.Object)
member.summary: Blocks the player from starting a video or pauses the video if active. This is useful for pre-roll ads. Warning: You MUST call ReleasePlayBlock eventually to get the player to play again.
member.param: The object applying the block. If the same object is added twice, it will be ignored.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IAdHost.ReleasePlayBlock(System.Object)
member.summary: Releases a play block created with AddPlayBlock
member.param: The object applying the block. If the object does not have a block, it will be ignored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IAdHost.AdMode
member.summary: Indicates that an ad is playing

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IAdHost.PlaybackBitrate
member.summary: The last known playback bitrate being used by the player

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IAdHost.Volume
member.summary: The current volume level of the player

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IAdHost.PlayState
member.summary: The state of the player

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IAdHost.Containers
member.summary: Containers available to the player for hosting ads. This is useful for companion and nonlinear ads.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IAdHost.VideoArea
member.summary: The main video area panel. This is useful for hosting linear ads.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IAdHost.Plugins
member.summary: A list of the currently available player plugins.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IAdHost.VolumeChanged
member.summary: Raised when the volume changes

member.name: E:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IAdHost.StateChanged
member.summary: Raised when the player state changes

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IPlayer.ScheduleAdTrigger(Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.Advertising.IAdSequencingTrigger,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Schedules an ad that is to be handled by an AdPayloadHandlerPlugin. A valid AdPayloadHandlerPlugin must be part of your application or this will not be handled.
member.param: An object containing information about the ad source and target
The position within the media where this ad should be played. If ommited ad will begin playing immediately.
member.returns: An object that contains information about the scheduled ad.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IPlayer.RemoveScheduledAd(Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.Advertising.ScheduledAd)
member.summary: Removes a scheduled ad that was the result of a call to ScheduleAdTrigger
member.param: The scheduled ad created from the AdTrigger that was scheduled.

member.summary: Schedules an ad to be played by this plugin.
member.param: The source of the ad content.
The delivery method of the ad content.
The position within the media where this ad should be played. If ommited ad will begin playing immediately.
The offset/startup position of the ad.
The URL where the user should be directed when they click the ad.
The duration of the ad content that should be played. If ommitted the plugin will play the full duration of the ad content.
Indicates if the timeline of the currently playing media should be paused while the ad is playing.
Another scheduled ad that this ad should be appended to. If ommitted this ad will be scheduled independently.
User data.
member.returns: A reference to the IAdContext that contains information about the scheduled ad.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IPlayer.HasCaptions
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the current video contains closed captions.

member.summary: Indicates that the current content contains video.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IPlayer.HasAudio
member.summary: Indicates that the current content contains audio.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IPlayer.ActiveMediaPlugin

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IPlayer.ContentStartPosition
member.summary: Returns the startup position of the current content. This setting is what allows the application to automatically seek into a video on startup (useful for restoring a video position).

member.summary: Returns custom metadata associated with the player instance.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IPlayer.DataReceived

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IS3DPlugin.Is3DPluginEnabled

member.name: E:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.IS3DPlugin.S3DPropertiesInvalid

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.AdProgress
member.summary: Indicates the progress of an ad as it is being played.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.Advertising.AdMarker
member.summary: Represents an advertisment marker to be handled by an IAdPayloadHandlerPlugin.

remarks.para: The position of a AdMarker represents its specific time location in a media clip.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.MediaMarker
member.summary: Represents the base class for markers.

remarks.para: Markers signify a time location in a media file. Each marker has a Begin and End time.

There are two specific types of marker objects:
            
            
CaptionMediaMarker objects represent caption text that can be displayed at a specific time in the media.
            /// 
TimelineMediaMarker objects can be displayed on the timeline

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.MediaMarker.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether two markers are references to the same marker.
member.returns: true if the markers compared are the same marker; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.MediaMarker.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets a unique identifier for the marker.
member.remarks: The Id is used to determine which markers are new each time polling occurs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.MediaMarker.Begin
member.summary: Gets or sets the begin position in the media stream of this marker item.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.MediaMarker.End
member.summary: Gets or sets the end position in the media stream of this marker item.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.MediaMarker.Content
member.summary: Gets or sets the text associated with this marker.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.MediaMarker.Duration
member.summary: Gets the duration of this marker (calculated from start time to end time).
member.remarks: The property value is calculated (it cannot be set) and is provided as a convenience.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.MediaMarker.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of marker (such as caption or display).

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.MediaMarker.BeginText
member.summary: Gets a text representation of the marker begin time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.MediaMarker.DurationText
member.summary: Gets a text representation of the marker duration time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.MediaMarker.EndText
member.summary: Gets a text representation of the marker end time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.Advertising.AdMarker.Immediate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether MediaMarker.Begin should be ignored and the marker should be triggered immediately.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.Advertising.AdMarker.ScheduledAd
member.summary: Gets or sets the ScheduledAd object associated with this AdMarker. This contains required information about the Ad Trigger and Payload produced once the AdMarker is handled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.Advertising.TargetRegions.VideoArea
member.summary: Targets the area over the video playback area.

member.summary: Targets an area at the bottom of the video playback area.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.Advertising.TargetRegions.UpperVideoArea
member.summary: Targets an area at the top of the video playback area.

member.summary: Targets an area at the left of the video playback area.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.Advertising.TargetRegions.RightVideoArea
member.summary: Targets an area at the right of the video playback area.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.Advertising.FailurePolicyEnum
member.summary: Provides the choices for how to handle failures.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.Advertising.FailurePolicyEnum.Ignore
member.summary: No matter what fails, ignore it. e.g. If a companion ad fails, still play the associated linear ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.Advertising.FailurePolicyEnum.Abort
member.summary: If there is any failure at any level, cancel out of the entire AdSpot.

member.summary: The payload associated with operation

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.Advertising.HandleCompletedEventArgs.Success
member.summary: Flag indicating success vs. failure. Success criteria is based on the FailureStrategy property.

member.summary: The payload for a handled AdSequencingSource

member.summary: Deactivates the payload

member.name: E:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.Advertising.IAdPayload.Deactivated
member.summary: Provides notification that the payload has been deactivated

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.Advertising.ScheduledAd
member.summary: Provides information about a scheduled ad. This class is intended to be assigned to AdMarker.ScheduledAd

member.summary: Creates a new ScheduledAd.
member.param: The ad sequencing trigger that defines source and target information for the ad.

member.summary: Forces the ad to be deactivated.

member.summary: The ad sequencing trigger that defines source and target information for the ad.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.Advertising.ScheduledAd.PayloadChanged
member.summary: Fired when the payload changes. This indicates that an ad payload handler has handled the ad.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.Advertising.ScheduledAd.Deactivated
member.summary: Fired when the ad payload is deactivated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.Advertising.ScheduledAd.Payload
member.summary: This is the tie to an active ad.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.ChunkDownloadStrategy
member.summary: Indicates the strategy to use to dowbload data chunks, which are typically captions or ad markers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.ChunkDownloadStrategy.Unspecified
member.summary: If set on a playlist item, the player's setting is used. If set on player, AsNeeded is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.ChunkDownloadStrategy.AggressiveFromCurrent
member.summary: All chunks are downloaded, starting with future chunks then working backwards from current position.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.ChunkDownloadStrategy.AggressiveFromStart
member.summary: All chunks are downloaded, starting with future chunks then working forwards from beginning of stream.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.ChunkDownloadStrategy.AggressiveFuture
member.summary: All future chunks are downloaded.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.ChunkDownloadStrategy.AsNeeded
member.summary: Data chunks are only downloaded if the chunk timestamp falls near the current position. Chunks in future (up to 60 seconds) are downloaded first, then most recent chunk within 60 seconds.

member.summary: Indicates how the media is delivered.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.LogLevel
member.summary: Indicates the severity level for a log entry.
member.remarks: The LogLevel is used by plug-ins to indicate the severity of a log entry. The Player has a LogLevel property that indicates what level of severity is required for a log entry to be logged (written to a LogWriter). For example, if a plug-in sends a log entry of LogLevel.Information and the Player.LogLevel property is set to LogLevel.Error, the log entry will not be written to a LogWriter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.MediaPluginState
member.summary: Indicates the state of an IMediaPlugin.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.S3D.S3D_Formats
member.summary:
Indicates the 3D format.
DiscreteTrack represents a Left or Right stream and is only valid when S3D_Content is set to DiscreteLeft or DiscreteRight.
SideBySide represents a frame-compatible formatted stream which contains Left and Right images stacked horizontally within the frame.
TopAndBottom represents a frame-compatible formatted stream which contains Left and Right images stacked vertically within the frame.
FrameSequential represents a stream where Left and Right frames alternate in chronological order.
FieldAlternative represents an interlaced stream where Left and Right images are coded as interlaced fields.
SideBySide, TopAndBottom, FrameSequential and FieldAlternative are only valid when S3D_Content is set to Pair.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.S3D.S3D_Contents
member.summary:
None describes a plain 2D source.
Pair describes a typical 3D source which contains both L and R images in the same stream.
DiscreteLeft/DiscreteRight describes a single stream which contains only the Left or Right images of a stereo pair, but is different than None in that it implies that another discrete stream is available which together with this one forms a complete 3D pair.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.S3D.S3D_EyePriorities
member.summary:
LeftFirst indicates left eye images are delivered first in an image pair.
RightFirst indicates right eye images are delivered first in an image pair.
First means left half in SideBySide; top half in TopAndBottom, even frames in FrameSequential; and even lines in FieldAlternative.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.S3D.S3D_SubsamplingModes
member.summary: None indicates no special subsampling algorithm was used to scale the left and right images. The other subsampling modes are only valid when S3D_Format is set to SideBySide or TopAndBottom.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.S3D.S3D_SubsamplingOrders
member.summary: None indicates no special subsampling algorithm was used to scale the left and right images. The other subsampling orders are only valid when S3D_SubsamplingMode is set to values not equal to None.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.S3D.S3DProperties.S3DFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the stereoscopic 3D format of the media.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.S3D.S3DProperties.S3DContent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the stereoscopic 3D content type of the media.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.S3D.S3DProperties.S3DEyePriority
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the stereoscopic 3D eye priority of the media.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.S3D.S3DProperties.S3DSubsamplingModes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the stereoscopic 3D subsampling mode of the media.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.S3D.S3DProperties.S3DSubsamplingOrders
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the stereoscopic 3D subsampling order the media.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.S3D.S3DProperties.S3DLeftEyePAR
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the stereoscopic 3D left eye pixel aspect ratio the media.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.S3D.S3DProperties.S3DRightEyePAR
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the stereoscopic 3D right eye pixel aspect ratio the media.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Primitives.StreamType
member.summary: Indicates the type of an IMediaStream.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Resources.PluginsResources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Resources.PluginsResources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Resources.PluginsResources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Resources.PluginsResources.DebugLogWriterOutputFormat
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Severity: "{0}" Sender: "{1}" Message: "{2}" Timestamp: "{3}".

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.Resources.PluginsResources.TimeSpanReadableFormat
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to {0:00}:{1:00}:{2:00}.
